Posts.Content: --I take a walk on any good weather days and let the tears fall I seem to cry alot in the car---I have cried in line at the gro store---It is a natural way of dealing with the stress and grief. I am crying less now and fealing better. I presented at stage IV  Sept 2012 at age 51. The fact that you were offered surgery is a good sign, it means that they think they can get a good result with that--maybe some clean up with radiation and or chemo--not easy for sure but doable--I am on my second round of chemo after 5 mos. in remission. I plan on living every moment and if I have to hop-skip & jump every 5 mos. in order seeing my grandkids grow up I'm there---every day we make there are better treatments. With any luck one of us will be the key that makes  prevention/cure a possiblity so no other women will have to follow us.
Posts.Title: worried with my breast cancer

Posts.Content: Finished chemo Jan 10 2012---twelve doses in thirteen weeks--skipped week 6 due to shingles outbreak---came back thick and curly, just long enough now to start trimming, CANCER back --chemo round two--first dose june 26--second dose was july 2-----Dyed my hair bright purple---this time my hair will go out in style---I am 51-- my hair was long and beautiful--maybe I will have it back someday--It took awhile to get used to wigs but they are easy to throw on and go and if you get at beauty supply house reasonably priced.
Posts.Title: Scared about losing hair

Posts.Title: Scared about losing hair

Posts.Content: Stage 4 with bone/lung mets from the start--Do you have access to a pool? I started swimming in an attempt to wear myself out to sleep past the steriods--didn't make me sleep, but has taken the numbness in arm/legs away. I went on online and looked up some basic water arobics has helped with the back pain.
Posts.Title: Breast/Bone Stage 4
